item.title: Basics of Git
item.description:
What is Git for, and what is a version control system anyway? A version control system is a system that records changes to a file or set of files over time and allows you to revert to a specific version later. Simply put, in case of a file change, the file and the place of the change will be marked, you can also undo the previously entered file changes, see who last changed something and caused the problem and when, and much more. If you break something or lose files, you can easily fix it.

One such system is Git. At the moment, it is the most common for a number of reasons:

  • Free and open source
  • Fast
  • Simple branching
  • Backup

Hostings are provided for git repositories, for example: GitHub, Codebase, Bitbucket, GitLab и др.

Basic commands:

git init - creating a new repository

git status - view status of current files

git add - adding changes and new files to the current directory
git add file.py - adding a file file.py
git .add - adding all changes

git commit - creating a new commit
git commit -m 'text' - create a commit with the name text

git branch - managing branches in a repository
git branch — shows a list of all branches
git branch name — creates a new branch name
git branch -D name — deletes a branch name

git checkout - switching between recent commits
git checkout file — revert file to last commit state

git config - git configuration and options
git config --global user.name — shows username
git config --global user.name 'New name' — changes username
git config --global user.email — shows the user's email
git config --global user.email 'name@gmail.com' — changes the user's email

git push - uploading local commits to a remote repository

git pull - downloads changes from the remote repository to the local one

git clone - cloning a project from a remote repository

item.title: Microsoft FrontPage
item.description:
Content:

    1. General information
    2. Frontpage installation
    3. My web-page
    4. Conclusion

General information

Web-pages can be created in several ways - from scratch or based on some kind of template. Both of these approaches can be implemented in Microsoft FrontPage. This editor was one of the best of its time, allowing you to edit HTML code, as well as view all changes in direct view mode. This editor did not require knowledge of the basics of HTML.

The main features of the editor:

  • create and save web-pages
  • save web-pages directly to the Web
  • view and administer web-pages
  • create complex web-page designs
  • use ready-made HTML tags
  • use ready-made images from the program delivery kit, etc.

Frontpage installation

Installation of the program is simple, available when you install Office 2003.

My web-page

I will not dwell on creating a web-page in detail, since in fact we are working with the Microsoft Word interface. I will only show the final web-page.

Conclusion

Obviously, it is impossible to create a site with a modern design on a program for Windows XP, but despite this, some sites written in FrontPage still work. The Microsoft Frontpage was replaced by Microsoft Expression Web and Microsoft SharePoint Designer.
